result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Cabreda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable surcharges at the rate of $52.00 bi-weekly via Wage Assignment.
Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge with the payment plan imposed for restitution. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant to involve self in psychiatric counseling immediately.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with E.J.Z. or her residence.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment within 30 days and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 11/6/15. Hearing set 11/6/15 at 8:15 a.m. to verify Defendant has done counseling with letter from counselor and involved in AODA - Court may modify this jail sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
Defendant to perform 40 hours uncompensated Community Service within the term of probation with Agent's approval.

Court heard, imposes sent.:

Count 2: 
8 mos DCJ to run concurrent w/ one another to comm. on or before 9/24/2016 by 6:00 pm.

Count 3: 
90 days DCJ to run concurrent w/ one another to comm. on or before  9/24/2016 by 6:00 pm.

Modifying JOC - jail set out to 4/1/16

Defendant, Joseph Cabreda in court, Victim/witness appears for the State of Wisconsin; This is to review counseling; Court questions Def.; discussion on counseling, recomm. from Agent; Court sets out 60 days, Def. to go to AA

Defendant, Joseph Cabreda in court, No appearance for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Witness Coordinator from DA's office does appear; Def. heard on counseling; victim rights complied with; Court is not satisfied with response; Court orders Def. to continue with Psychiatric Associates and wants letter from them on progress, Court orders Def. to complete AODA; Court will delay commencement of jail until mid-January - at the hearing in mid-January, Def. must bring letter from counselor from Psychiatric Associates, Def must go to at least one AA meeting; new hearing set 1/15/16 at 8:15am; Court fills out Order Modifying JOC

15CM271 & 15CM323: Defendant, Joseph Cabreda in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is P&S and Initial on 15CM323 (to be D&RI); Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews right to counsel; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Count 2 Criminal Trespass and Count 3 DC; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas and waiver made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Criminal Trespass in Count 2 and DC in Count 3 w/Count 1 D&RI and 15CM323 is D&RI; State heard; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 2 years
- involve self in psychiatric counseling immediately
- no contact with E.J.Z. or her residence
- AODA within 30 days and follow through
- 40 hours Community Service
- Rest. $1,325.36 to victim - to be paid at $52 every 2 weeks via WA (Def. to stop down to get same)
- $243 CC each count
- $200 DNA surcharge/each count
- 60 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 11/6/15; Def. to come to court and show he has counseling - letter from counselor and involved in AODA

- hearing set 11/6/15 at 8:15am
Defendant, Joseph Cabreda in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. is trying to hire attorney; JT remains; bond cont.; State gives Def. new recomm.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with EJZ f/w dob 11/2/1981 or her residence.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

1:03 - Defendant Joseph Cabreda in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (not eligible). Intern Kevin Schmidt under supervision of Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters Not guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with EJZ f/w dob 11/2/81 and her residence.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
